Todd Road Jail Notary

Mobile Notary at Todd Road Jail in Ventura County

On-site notarization for inmates at Ventura County's sentenced and longer-term housing facility. We travel to Todd Road Jail in Santa Paula so inmates can sign powers of attorney, court documents, and other legal paperwork without waiting until release.

Located at 600 Todd Road in Santa Paula, California. Appointments coordinated around Ventura County visiting schedules and security procedures.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Todd Road Notary Appointment
Facility information

About Todd Road Jail in Ventura County

Todd Road Jail is Ventura County's primary sentenced and longer-term housing facility, operated by the Ventura County Sheriff's Office. It houses inmates serving county sentences and those in specialized programs such as work-release.

  • Address: 600 Todd Rd, Santa Paula, CA 93060
  • Main phone: (805) 654‑3335
  • Visiting info line: (805) 654‑3335
  • Operated by: Ventura County Sheriff’s Office
  • Capacity: Approximately 796 inmates
  • Visiting days: Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday, Sunday
  • Visit length: 30 minutes; 2 visits per inmate per week
  • Max visitors: 2 adults, or 1 adult + 1 minor per visit
  • Check-in: Arrive 1 hour before; no check-ins after 30 minutes before session end
  • Photo ID required: Valid driver’s license, state ID, passport, military ID, or immigration ID
  • Location: Santa Paula, approximately 70 minutes from Los Angeles via US‑101

Why inmates at Todd Road need notary services

  • Family and custody matters — Guardianship, school authorizations, and visitation arrangements.
  • Financial and property decisions — Powers of attorney so relatives can manage bank accounts, bills, and property.
  • Court and legal paperwork — Declarations, affidavits, and other documents needed for active cases.
  • Real estate and vehicles — Deeds, titles, and other documents needed to manage homes, cars, and other assets.

Todd Road Jail and the Ventura County Main Jail (Pre‑Trial Detention Facility) share the same visiting guidelines and scheduling system but have separate visiting schedules and phone numbers. We confirm the correct facility before making the trip.

Documents we notarize

Common Documents for Todd Road Jail Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Financial institution and benefits forms

Court, family, and other documents

  • Declarations and affidavits for court
  • Child custody, guardianship, and visitation documents
  • Divorce and support-related documents
  • Real estate and lease agreements
  • Business and insurance forms
  • Any document requiring a notarized signature
How it works

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at Todd Road Jail

1. Contact us with the inmate’s information

Call or text with the inmate’s full legal name, booking number (if known), and a description of the documents that need to be notarized. Let us know your deadline so we can prioritize scheduling.

2. We confirm Todd Road procedures

Ventura County facilities have specific visiting sessions by housing unit on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday. We contact Todd Road Jail at (805) 654‑3335 to confirm the inmate’s availability and coordinate a professional visit, and verify the inmate is housed at Todd Road and not the Main Jail.

3. Prepare your documents

Have all documents ready and complete before the appointment — we cannot draft legal documents, only notarize signatures. If the inmate needs to review documents first, coordinate with their attorney or use the facility’s mail system.

4. The notary appointment at Todd Road

We travel from Los Angeles to Todd Road Jail in Santa Paula (approximately 70 minutes via US‑101), clear security screening, and meet with the inmate in the designated visiting area. All visitors are subject to search, and no cell phones, wallets, or personal items are allowed in the visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarization.

5. Document delivery

After the appointment, we return the signed and notarized documents to you, your attorney, escrow company, or other designated recipient — by hand delivery, courier, or mail depending on your timeline.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Appointment

Tip: Todd Road primarily houses sentenced inmates and those in longer-term custody. If the person was recently arrested, they are more likely at the Ventura County Main Jail in downtown Ventura. Call us and we will confirm the correct facility before scheduling.

Pricing

Todd Road Jail Notary Fees

Jail notarizations at Todd Road Jail require travel from Los Angeles to Santa Paula, coordination with facility staff, security screening, and wait time. Pricing reflects the distance and the complexity of working within the facility’s procedures.

  • Todd Road appointments: Starting at $300
  • Price includes travel, coordination, wait time, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or specific‑time appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to Todd Road Jail and back
  • Coordination with Todd Road procedures and scheduling
  • Security screening and wait time
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Final pricing depends on the number of documents, any special circumstances, and timing. Call or text for a quote based on your specific situation.

Common Questions

Todd Road Jail Notary FAQs

Where is Todd Road Jail located?

Todd Road Jail is located at 600 Todd Rd, Santa Paula, CA 93060. It is approximately 70 minutes from Los Angeles via US‑101.

How do I confirm someone is housed at Todd Road Jail?

You can search the Ventura County Sheriff’s inmate locator online or call (805) 654‑3335. Be sure to confirm whether the inmate is at Todd Road or the Main Jail in Ventura, as they are separate facilities.

What are the visiting days and check-in rules at Todd Road?

Visiting days are Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday. Each visit is 30 minutes, with two visits per inmate per week. Check‑in starts 1 hour before and closes 30 minutes before the session ends.

What can I bring into Todd Road Jail during a visit?

Only your personal key ring, photo ID, and one baby bottle or blanket if bringing an infant. No cell phones, wallets, purses, backpacks, food, beverages, cameras, or reading materials are allowed. The facility does not hold items and there are no storage lockers.

What is the difference between Todd Road Jail and the Ventura County Main Jail?

The Main Jail (Pre‑Trial Detention Facility) in downtown Ventura primarily houses pre‑trial detainees and handles initial booking. Todd Road in Santa Paula primarily houses sentenced inmates and those in longer‑term custody, with different addresses and visiting schedules.

How long should I plan for a Todd Road notary appointment?

Plan for 3 to 4 hours total including travel from Los Angeles (approximately 70 minutes each way via US‑101), security screening, wait time, and the signing.
